titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stanford Historical Society Records
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives
publicationstmt.p: Copyright © 2015 The Board of Trustees of the Leland Stanford Junior University. All rights reserved.

note.p: This encoded finding aid is compliant with Stanford EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Records pertain to sponsored events, publications, Stanford historical topics, and other administrative matters and include correspondence, memoranda, minutes, financial records, articles, clippings, and membership card files.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Stanford Historical Society Records (SC0903). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: The Stanford Historical Society was founded in 1976 to encourage the study and understanding of Stanford University's history and the ideals of the University's founders.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Records pertain to sponsored events, publications, Stanford historical topics, and other administrative matters and include correspondence, memoranda, minutes, financial records, articles, clippings, and membership card files.

did.unittitle: List of Memorial Plaques on campus

Letter from Ken and La Verne Wilson, 1985, relating Ken's examination of a gold mining prospect for Lou Henry Hoover in 1935, with a copy of her thank you letter to him and her cook's recipe for heart shaped cookies [all photocopies]
ASSU Council of Presidents (and Senior Class Pres.)
Bailey, Margery- re possible publication of her letters, 1984-87
Book Sales, mostly of Kiester’s book on D. Tresidder, 1992-93
Civil Engineering: copy of One Hundred Years of Civil Engineering at Stanford and cover letter, 1991
Coutts, Peter: copies of historical documents and correspondence re buildings on campus
Department of Parks and Recreation (Sacramento Historic Sites)
Durand letters – correspondence re donation of, 1984
Foothills to the Bay (publication), prospectus, 1978, correspondence, 1981-92
Ginzton, Artemus, letters re Memorial for Caroline Charles
Janss Foundation (Mr. William Janss) – pertains to Kiester’s book on Tresidder, 1990-93
Jewel Fund and Jewel Fund Booklet
Oak Tree (at Mausoleum?), memo from H. Page re marking a cross section, 1993
Stanford’s Palo Alto Stock Farm (contains copy of D. Regnery’s “French Bronze Horse Statue and the PASF Horse Cemetery,” 1984)
Stanford Stakes (horserace) – photo of winning horse and owner, 1990
Thank You Letters (to members, gift givers, generous…)
Wakins, James T. IV – Memorial Resolution, clippings, related correspondence
“Words Worth A Second Thought” memo re reprinting
1910-1925 Leases and housing fund information copied from Board of Trustee documents
715 Salvatierra, draft of description and copies of documents
Book IV – sources at Maps and Records
Charles Kaiser Sumner, Architect (booklet from Palo Alto Stanford Heritage house tour, Dec. 9, 2007)
Early Residences on Stanford University's San Juan Hill (booklet from Palo Alto Stanford Heritage house tour Dec. 12, 2004)
Julie C. Lythcott-Haims, Remarks at "Discover Stanford," Sept. 27, 2002
Newspaper photocopy, "Homes being built on campus sites" July 24, 1929
Press packet photos on a CD
Santa Clara County Historical and Genealogical Society 2005
Santa Clara County Historical Preservation Ordinance, 2003-06
